However, when we did get there, my little brother and his friend met this ticket seller from Ebay and ended up getting SEVENTH ROW SEATS! So Janine and I took their original seats which were in the 100 level to the side of the stage. They were pretty awesome seats and we had a great time. It was the first night I wasn't worried about a paper, what I had to get done before next semester, etc. While one might say the encore was a little lacking, the set was excellent! Speaking of next semester, I think I might actually have a place to live. A friend of mine-Jan from English classes, had a problem with her roommate this semester and she is moving out next semester. So she mentioned to me that the place in the room would be opening up, and asked if I was interested in moving in so I said sure. Its pretty much a done deal! I'm pretty excited to actually have a roommate I know and like, and my best buds Sam and Matt as down the hall neighbors!<3 Yesterday I went up to talk to the chair of the Education Department about student teaching. She gave me the paper work- and it basically comes down to this! All I need to do is try and take some kind of "G" class this summer or next year- and take Media over the summer. The 3 Education classes count as my "D" class. YES! This is good news- as long as I do relatively well in my classes I can graduate on time WITH teaching certification! After talking with her, I hung out all night at Matt and Sam's and played board games with them and their group of friends-- it was a good FRIENDLY environment and definitely what some of us needed. Earlier in the evening I ran into the lounge and jumped onto a couch and hit my head on the wood- I think I might have had a minor concussion which sucks but I am okay now. I just kept talking and didn't pass out. Sam, being the bestest of friends he is was very nice to take care of me. My parents are having a party tomorrow night so that should be cool and than this weekend I'll have to figure out what is going on, depending on work. Hopefully all goes well and I'll see ya soon people<3<3 ~Chrissy

Hey all-

Just a quick update.

Went back to work Monday--it was pretty rough remembering everything, but it looks like I'll mostly be up front anyway. Certain people have too many doubts in me there and this is probably the last time I'm gonna work there only for a change in scenery.

Viagra paper for Bio done
Lit paper is fucking HARD- everyone is having trouble. I did start though- I'm about a page and a half in and still searching for my second source. I had too many distractions today and yesterday and this weekend will be quality time with me, the library, and what I have to get done.
Still have to register for the PRAXIS I and pick up student teaching stuff.

Uphi rush was fun last night and it was good to see everyone. I hope I get to meet more of the prospective girls soon enough.

I have been very upset over a certain situation today but I am now going to acknowledge that in order to get it out of my head. After all-- I shouldn't fret-- Joey and Dawson may have spent many years not talking, but in the end they remained friends, and remained important to each other.

Its good to be back in the USA but I still feel like I'm missing something--oh yeah...maybe its that I'm terribly UNHAPPY! I do miss you Florence, as much as you drove me nuts sometimes.

Good luck with finals everyone! :)

I cant forget writing an update on BERLIN!! It was absolutely amazing. It was definitely my favorite place I have gone to in Europe...

The weather was really cold, in fact it even snowed, but this hardly put a damper on our perfect weekend. We arrived in Berlin late on Thursday night and went right to sleep.  On Friday morning we ended up walking around the whole city center ourselves and finding some really cool hotspots.  Amongst them were:  the oldest Jewish graveyard, a church, a big carnival, the Berlin cathederal and canals, Christmas trees!, STARBUCKS, and in the afternoon a trip the Checkpoint Charlie Museum. The Museum was particularly interesting because we learned how all of the people escaped over the Berlin Wall. Some people hid themselves in a speaker box--that one was pretty cool. During the evening, we went to the oldest Irish pub in Berlin to have dinner and some Strongbow and German beer. The night ended in us getting all of our food and drinks for free. These army guys from Kentucky and NYC came to the table and decided to buy us everything! I did my first carbomb there. I had a lot of fun with them but I am pretty sure they had alterior motives- as most guys do. However, I did get very drunk and Kate and I decided to join the kareoke night that was happening in the other part of the bar. We sang and everyone liked it. I never would have done that if I was sober b/c I would be too afraid. Singing in a choir is a bit different than at a kareoke bar in Germany where everyone is watching and hearing just you.

On Ssaturday morning, we had breakfast and then went back into town and did some more shopping and site seeing. We saw a portion of the Berlin Wall in the middle of town, and then went back out to the largest portion which is on the way out of the city. Unfortunately I only got pictures of the one portion. I am retarded with my damn camera. We ate lunch at a steakhouse and it was really amazing. Shopping was a huge success- I got some shoes!!!, underwear, sweaters, and some other souvenirs and stuff. Afterwards-we went to get our plane but it was DELAYED!!! Of course...just my like. I think it was a sign for me to stay in Berlin because it was my favorite place :P Kate and Catherine were making me nervous on the plane by sayng random lines from Ron White about crashing planes... not cool. Then, they had to "de-ice" (defrost) the wing of the plane before take off... after there were missing pilots...very encouraging. But, nevertheless, I got home and didn't die. 

OKAY- well finals are almost over, I have one final left and 2 presentations left and to finish rewriting a paper for English which seems to be coming along a lot better than the first time I tried to write it. Tomorrow is the last day I will have regular internet access. Then it will be very random until I go HOME!! So until then, everyone have a marvelous Thanksgiving and see ya soon :)

~Chrissy

I have been feeling really insecure about my relationship with Dan lately and I really dont know why. Sometimes I wish that he would act a certain way or do something more for me, and I cant make him do that. I think its just the distance thats making me insecure right now so I am sure when I get home everything will lighten up.

Last weekend I went to Sienna, which is a small down just south of Italy. I went to the St. Catherine church and saw the famous head of St. Catherine. I also spent some time in the one of the largest squares of Italy, Piazza de Campo--alot of cool fountains, Baroque Art and pigeons! Pretty cool stuff. Afterwards, we went to the Duomo there which was under renovation at the time. It was pretty funny because the front of it would probably have been one of the most beautiful entraces to a church I had seen in Italy but it was covered by a picture of it to hide the renovations.

This week I have been increasingly sick with the chills and a headache that could kill someone....BUT luckily its getting better and of course I will still be going to Berlin tonight for the weekend with Kate and Cath so I will definitely update after that!

Ciao,
Chrissy

I find it interesting that two people who consist of an entire family keep so many things from each other. Whatever happened to family ties?? My host family which is the mother Anna, and her daughter Bianca are two of the nicest people I have ever met but they are seriously disfunctional. Bianca has been playing sick for a week and a half and refuses to go to school. Its kinda sad that whatever is bothering her she wont tell her mother about! It is obviously a serious problem because it has kept her home this long. The kicker was that she suddenly "got better" on Saturday night when I got home from Sienna and went to a party...but then was sick AGAIN on Sunday. And Anna, she has this boyfriend who she obviously wont bring into the home when Bianca is there. Bianca misses her father and wants him back but the divorce is over and Anna deserves to tell her the truth about the serious nature of her relationship with Alessandro, her boyfriend. If you ask me, I think my approaching departure will be a good opportunity for them to talk and reveal things to each other. I can see the tension- they need to see it.

Sorry that had nothing to do with anything, I just felt like sharing. 

15 days!

Chrissy

Hey all--

I hope all is well with everyone. This weekend I went back to Rome for an Ursinus student trip. Suprisingly, I learned alot more about the ancient and modern city than I had did last time. Apparently, the Pantheon is now a modern day church and this is why it is still preserved today. I had never known that. The Vatican tour was a bit more informative this time, but I was shocked and appalled the many tourists were taking pictures inside the Sistine chapel and these particular guards were not doing anything...I definitely didnt see this the last time I was there. On Sunday, it rained all day when we were at the Colesseum and I think I got sick---blah.

The days have gone so fast--and we are almost homeward bound. I will try to update after my trip to Berlin next weekend but it might be tough. There is alot of work to do coming up in all classes. This is the time wheres its most important to stay strong and get things done. This weekend is going to mostly be dedicated to getting work done and next weekend having fun and working simultaneously.

Three weeks left--and I feel like I have made true school friends--something which I had definitely lost over the months that passed last year. And, I have gained alot perspective and knowledge. The only disadvantage of this trip was putting me behind in my studies--something I will have to work hard for when I get back. Volkmer suggested my graduating in 2007 with my English major then coming back for student teaching. It sounds like a luxurious idea but I still have the ambition to graduate with both backgrounds at the normal time. Providing that I can get the summer classes I need, i can pull this off. If not, I will be around for Fall of 2007.

Dan has been getting a bit wierd with me lately. He says that he is "testy," which means he is too anxious about my return home and thats why hes acting this way. I find it wierd that sheer anticipation can make someone wierd? I dunno... I really hope is being truthful.

Other than that, not much going on...Clay and I did well on our Italian culture presentation which excited me. Tonight, we are cooking for another project...chestnut cake. Everyone loves a good chestnut here. Congrats UC to the rugby teams...apparently you all have done well and I am proud :)

Take care and see you all soon!!
Chrissy

This weekend I have to go to Rome again with Ursinus people which should be interesting I hope. I feel like I am doing everything twice but maybe I will learn something new...who knows? Ciao bitches.

I am currently in a bit of a rut here.  I am a month into the semseter abroad and my grades keep going down, down down.  This happens every year. No matter how hard I work nothing seems to help the situation.  Every test I take I get ridiculously worried and no matter how much effort I put into the test it doesnt help.  I filled out an application for student teaching this week, realizing that I might not even be able to graduate in 2007. I have fallen behind gradewise, and am hardly meeting the standard GPA that I need. And I work twice as hard as anyone else. I am sick of this shit. From here on out, my classes are going to be significantly harder, I will eventually have a capstone next year and everything else. I hate having to continuously worry about this stuff. I wish I could be like my boyfriend who gets a 3.8 every fucking semester and doesnt have any trouble with school, which sort of makes me sick. This isnt fair anymore...that I have to worry about my future when eveyone else is having fun in Italy.

For a while now I've gone on believing that I could have the best of both worlds.  I went on artifically believing that I could maintain a healthy relationship with someone I truly love, while stringing along another individual who I also happened to care deeply for which I cannot always whole-heartedly understand.  Yesterday I realized that this isn't possible, and I have lost one of these worlds.  Something tells me that this is just how things should be. And while I am pessimistic about how we will get on from here, I know that she is going to be a lucky girl and he is going to be happy.  It was selfish of me to drag him along- just plain wrong of me!! It's not who I am. It is time to finally put aside the feelings that we have and persist. For some odd reason, I believe that I may have more trouble with that than him... but the important part is that he is happy.

To the person that has stuck by me despite my faults and my annoyances, I thank you now Dan. You have made me happy and believed in me despite the confusion I have experienced and everything we've gone through for the past year. For a year I've loved you and I have never stopped...

Other than this, I'm not doing well in my classes and school here is hard for some reason. Someone tell me what I can do?  I'm enjoying Italy but I don't want to fail!!

~Chrissy

Ciao bitches,

So I am writing from London.  I am in the hostel waiting for the plane.  We had a very full weekend. I am mad tired but let me give you a quick run down of London.  

We arrived VERY LATE on Thursday evening.  In fact, we almost missed our damn plane!!  By the time we figured out how to get into London and got settled in at our hostel which was confusing and a joke it was about 3 in the morning.  We slept, woke up and went into town in Westminster- shopping, to a mall and a bunch of other stuff.  Later in the day, Clay and I ventured into the actual city and went to the British Museum which was cool and Russel Square.  Afterwards, we got fish and chips and went to a party at the other hostel, The Generator, where the rest of our group was staying- a much more happening place.  We also passed the time by drinking a cheap bottle of wine in the street. So let's talk about how much better I like Italy then London.  Expensive much?  The pound is ridiculous.  I would never study abroad here- all in all the trip kind of dissapointed me actually...well okay Saturday was alot better. On Saturday we woke up early and did some sight seeing.  We started at Buckingham Palace and saw a changing of the guards which was an all in all tourist trap...thousands of people there, you couldnt see shit. But Buckingham Palace was cool.  Afterwards, Clay and I went to see Big Ben, the giant clock that towers over the city.  On the way there, we decided to join a war protest.  Well, we more or less just kind of walked into it.  He asked me if I wouldn't mind marching in it.  I was like, what the hell?  I dont like the war- I'm not very into politics but I wouldn't mind showing support.  It was pretty cool and pretty informative for me.  I have never done anything like that before, and it seems like alot of people in London share similar views of our president, and his foreign policy with their prime minister.  Dan was proud of me that I took the iniative to do that, and to learn more about it.  I have a lot of literature that they handed out at the rally that can teach me more about what I was supporting beyond what I already know.  Besides this fact, we walked for nearly 2 hours and it was great excersize.  This exercize was definitely necessary because there is nothing in London to eat- fast food only.  Gross- in the past three days, I have had Mcdonalds twice,Subway once, fish and chips and today Pizza hut before leaving.  I feel fat and disguisting, but these are our only options. I can't wait to get back to Florence and eat the good stuff again, even though its alotta pasta I now realize just how amazingly healthy those meals are!!  Mmmm. Anyways- after this protest we went back to the hostel and got changed. Then we met Kristen, Jen and Clay's friend Brian at the GLOBE THEATER.  I think the trip was worth it just for this part.  The globe theater was amazing, I felt like I was experiencing history there!  It was beautiful, decorated nice, and really cultural.  We were surrounded by all kinda people- a big melting pot.  Then, we hung out till the show started.  The show was "A Winter's Tale," I had never read it in Shakespeare or anything but it was awesome.  If any of you know the story line- it is really confusing as to whether the story is a comedy or a tragedy because it is questionable as to whether someone dies in the end of the story.  But anyways- all in all hilarious Shakespearian play, costumes, accents, amazing dramatic and flawless acting- the whole nine yards. We paid 5 pounds to stand which was uncomfortable but totally worth it and this is the only part of the trip that I felt was really unquestionably worth my time in the end.  After the play we went to Subway then back to Clay's friend Brian's place (he's an actor studying abroad in London for a YEAR), then we hit up the club again in the Generator. I was originally very tired and moody but I ended up nice and tanked by the end of the evening.  Gotta love those Australian and South African men...hahahaha.  And it turns out my buddy Kristin on the trip has a bit in common with me ;)I didnt end up going to bed until about 3am in their hostel and only 3 hours of sleep.  I should sleep like a baby tonight.  Hope so considering the ton of work I have and tests thiw week..ugh. Now we are just kinda bumming around till the flight leaves. I am really excited to get back to Florence, my new home for now.  Well, fall break is in 2 weeks and yes I am going to other Italian cities with my parents. Nothing crazy and exciting like everything else. I would like to but I didnt know people would make those kinda plans when I agreed to have my parents come.  Oh well I will spending less money and I have all my arrangements made and honestly a week away might not be so bad. I really do wish Dan could've come... being a prospective, broke law student sucks for the guy's girlfriend..hahaha oh well I live.

So all in all I had a pretty cool weekend I just reccomend thinking twice before going to London, its alotta money! Hope you all had a fun weekend, miss you lots!

-Chrissy

Ciao! :)

Italy has been amazing thus far. The food is great, the people are pretty friendly (some of them too friendly), the transportation system-not so good, but we deal.... and the people on the trip are awesome. So far I have been all around the center of the city of Florence- the Duomo being the SPOT! Yesterday, Kirsten, Tom, Jen and I went to the Boboli Gardens which were absolutely beautiful. I want to live here someday...just bring everyone I care about over here and hang out. My host family is cool- they speak more English than I anticipated. Only complains- ITS HOT!!, THE BUG BITES, and OMG the freaking busses!- Not like they are any better in the states, I'm just not used to doing it... and in a city where I dont know where anything is... oh well it is getting better. The other night we went out bar hopping- MVP shot and "Sex on the Duomo."  Si, es molto buono.  I do miss you all though- and maybe we can try to arrange a time to talk or just send me some MAIL PLEASE!!! ahhh I want mail, very badly. No packages allowed though- just mail. Ummm classes...they seem okay. I'm sure Dr Volkmer's class will be rough because its him but the rest of the classes shouldn't be too bad! Oh well, I think I've written enough for just the first weekend...there will be many more to go bitches <3

Hope all is well in Htown, Ursinus, and at the good old Pmark....

Now into the city we go again!
~Chrissy

It has officially been about three years since I began smoking slightly before my senior year of high school. In these three years I have attempted to quit smoking 8 times. So okay the first few attempts were pretty lame and a waste of time, but the last few times were very legitimate- I have tried everything- the gum, going cold turkey, having someone take my cigarettes away from me, smoking "quest cigarettes" which contain trace levels of nicotine which can hardly harm your lungs, even taking up other addictions such as gambling. Let's face it- this is a rough addiction, and if you don't smoke I suggest you never start. (I NEVER offer my cigarettes to non-smokers unless they are so incredibly drunk they won't remember it). 

A few good things have happened lately that I hope will help me along the way. One-the smoking cessation readings were helpful. Second, my boss who I usually smoke with at work is trying to quit too- she is on the patch. She hasn't gone out for a smoke in like a week and a half. Third, drinking usually enhances smoking and since I've been dieting I haven't been drinking. Finally, pretty soon I will be living for three months in a country where smoking is prohibited in many public areas. It has been 6 days since my last pack was finished. I know soon that I am going to break. I have been holding out but my body and my mind are telling me I need it. I have devised yet another plan that probably won't work but I'm going to put it out there anyway. 

I figure within the next few days I will buy a pack of ultra light cigarettes (according to hard-core smokers- they are practically AIR). Hypothetically, let's say I bought them tonight- that would be six days since I finished my last pack. Then, when I finish this pack I will wait DOUBLE the amount of days I waited last time to buy a pack- this will be 12 days, then 24 days which is almost a month, and then the number of days will continue to grow. Hopefully, as the days go by my body will become less dependent on the cigarettes so I'll eventually stop buying. Also, when I go to Italy I plan on bringing a box of the nicorette because they now make them in flavors! Earlier in the year when I tried nicorette it only came in non-flavored and it tasted like shit and cardboard- that's why it didn't work. Hopefully this will point me in a good direction. I know my mind doesn't want them but my body does and unless scientists find a cure for cancer in the next 40 years or so- I want to make a goal to at least keep trying.

~Chrissy
